0.title: Girls, boys sitting together in classroom won't lead to gender equality: Cong
0.article_body: Senior Congress leader K Muraleedharan on Sunday said making girls and boys sit together in the classroom will not lead to gender equality. "Not everyone would welcome it. It is not just the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) which is against it. A lot of people in Kerala have not accepted that concept. It is unnecessary," he said.

1.title: She was an icon: Adnan Sami mourns demise of Pak singer Nayyara Noor
1.article_body: Singer Adnan Sami took to Twitter to share a post mourning the demise of Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor. "Just learned the sad news that legendary singer Nayyara Noor Sahiba has passed away. She was an icon and her contribution to music will be remembered and loved forever," he wrote. Nayyara passed away on Sunday at the age of 71.

2.title: 1 booked after Hanuman idol vandalised in Delhi's Mahendra Park
2.article_body: A case has been registered against a person for allegedly vandalising a Hanuman idol at a small temple in northwest Delhi's Mahendra Park area, police said. A video showing a man with a rod near the temple was reportedly accessed by locals. Police suspect that the accused vandalised the idol in a drunken stupor. He is yet to be arrested.

3.title: India Women are also as talented as other teams: Batter Yastika Bhatia
3.article_body: Speaking about India Women's mindset against England Women in semi-final at CWG 2022, India Women batter Yastika Bhatia said her side had certain plans against certain batters and bowlers and had practised accordingly. "It was all about executing that well on...ground. We're also as talented as other teams...it was all about holding our nerves in crunch situations," she added.

4.title: Supreme Court agrees to hear review petition of PMLA judgement
4.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to list a review petition against its earlier judgement which upheld the constitutional validity of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. When the plea was mentioned, a bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana said, "Okay, we will list it." Following the previous verdict, various Opposition parties expressed their apprehension over its 'long-term implications'.

5.title: Maharashtra govt to pay fees of college students who lost both parents to COVID-19
5.article_body: The Maharashtra government will bear the education cost of college students who've lost both their parents to COVID-19, state Minister Chandrakant Patil said. "As many as 931 undergraduate and 228 postgraduate students of various government colleges have lost both their parents to COVID-19," Patil announced in the state Assembly. This will cost the state exchequer over ₹2 crore annually.

6.title: Man throws egg at Ganpati procession in Mumbai; arrested
6.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly throwing an egg at a Ganpati procession in Mumbai's Kamathipura area on Sunday. A crowd gathered at the spot soon after the incident took place. The police said that there was no communal issue in the area and the matter was resolved immediately.

7.title: 50 'bee hotels' installed in B'luru, bee population being sampled
7.article_body: Scientists at Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE) have placed 50 "bee hotels" across Bengaluru to integrate bees into urban spaces and encourage conservation efforts. The scientists have begun sampling the city's bee population. The decline in bee population due to human interference could not be ascertained earlier as sampling has never been carried out before.

8.title: Director N Lingusamy, his brother sentenced to 6 months in jail in cheque fraud case
8.article_body: 'The Warriorr' director N Lingusamy and his brother N Subash Chandra Bose have been sentenced to six months in jail in a cheque fraud case. The case was filed against the brothers by a production company after they didn't repay over ₹1 crore they had taken from them. The brothers had given a cheque to the production company, which bounced.

9.title: Friends insert steel glass inside man at a party in Gujarat, pic of X-ray surfaces
9.article_body: A man's friends inserted a steel glass inside him through his rectum during a party in Gujarat's Surat. The man, who hails from Odisha, was in a drunken state when the incident happened. He returned to Odisha and got it surgically removed after 10 days at Brahmapur's MKCG Medical College And Hospital. A picture of his X-ray has surfaced online.

10.title: Job aspirant holding Tricolour thrashed and caned by Patna ADM in public, video surfaces
10.article_body: A video of Patna ADM KK Singh beating up and caning a job aspirant in public has surfaced online. In the video, the aspiring teacher can be seen holding the National Flag and lying on the road. KK Singh can be seen thrashing him with a stick and caning him. The job aspirant has been admitted to a hospital.

11.title: Sequoia’s Surge selects 15 Indian, SEA startups for its 7th cohort
11.article_body: Sequoia India and Sequoia Southeast Asia's rapid scale-up programme Surge launched its seventh cohort of 15 startups and has invested a total of $41 million. The startups in this cohort are mostly focused on software and deep-tech firms and there is no investment in edtech or Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) segments. According to a statement, Surge 07 is a 16-week hybrid programme.

12.title: 8-yr-old Delhi girl missing for 2 weeks found dead with her throat slit
12.article_body: The body of an eight-year-old girl, who was missing for two weeks, was found near Delhi's Yamuna Khadar area, police said on Sunday. The girl had gone missing on August 5, police said, adding that the girl was gagged and her throat slit. It is also suspected that a known person committed the crime, a police official said.

13.title: Evacuations ordered, schools shut over heavy rains in Odisha, MP
13.article_body: Heavy rains triggered massive floods and caused swelling of rivers in Odisha, due to which authorities evacuated 1.2 lakh people in Balasore and Mayurbhanj districts in two days. Meanwhile, in Madhya Pradesh, many parts witnessed heavy rainfall, resulting in closure of schools. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that Bay of Bengal will witness a deep depression from August 23.

14.title: You seriously deserved that: Yuvraj to Shubman on his 1st international ton
14.article_body: Congratulating India opener Shubman Gill on his maiden international century against Zimbabwe in the third ODI, Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "Finally!!! Well played Shubman, you seriously deserved that ton!" He added, "Many more to come, this is just a start." The 22-year-old scored 130 runs in 97 balls in Harare today.

15.title: PM Modi will lose in 2024 if he doesn't file affidavit in Ram Setu case: Swamy
15.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy has commented on the ongoing Supreme Court case where he seeks for “Ram Setu” to be granted the status of national heritage. “The [Supreme Court]...directed to Govt to file a yes no affidavit. If yes, then [it’s] my victory. If no, then it [is PM Narendra] Modi’s defeat in 2024 [Lok Sabha polls],” Swamy tweeted.

16.title: 4 dead, 2 lose eyesight after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
16.article_body: Four people died, while two others lost eyesight after allegedly consuming poisonous liquor at two villages in Bihar's Rohtas. Those who died include a 72-year-old retired circle inspector. Officials were camping in the area and conducting raids against the liquor mafia. A police officer said 12 mafia members were arrested and 212 litres of liquor was seized in two days.

17.title: Bihar staring at worst-ever drought in last 5 decades: state Agriculture Minister
17.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh said with 40% deficient rains and paddy sowing being hit, Bihar is staring at perhaps the "worst-ever drought in the last five decades". The Indian Express quoted him as saying, "CM Nitish Kumar and I have been moving in the field to make the assessment on the ground and are finding the situation very alarming."

18.title: 'Delhi model' is to give honesty certificates to corrupts: Thakur
18.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur questioned Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal’s silence over corruption charges against his deputy and asserted that Kejriwal's Delhi model is to award honesty certificates to dishonest ministers. “Kejriwal model decoded. You spend hundreds of crores of rupees to do publicity with no accountability. And when you get caught, you fix the liability on someone else,” said Thakur.

19.title: Won't accept inclusion of non-locals, would end J&K's identity: Abdullah
19.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on Monday said the "inclusion of non-local voters" in the electoral rolls of J&K was not acceptable to the parties and that it would end the union territory's identity. "The Assembly will be in the hands of the outsiders and the people here will be denied," Abdullah said.

20.title: I'm seeking justice, man who said he loved her maligning her image: Jiah's mother
20.article_body: Late actress Jiah Khan's mother Rabia stated that she is like any mother seeking justice for her daughter. "The man who claimed to love her is maligning her image...The accused is hiding," she said. Jiah committed suicide in 2013 and blamed her former partner Sooraj Pancholi in her suicide note. Rabia has testified that Sooraj verbally and physically abused Jiah.

21.title: Form is temporary, class is permanent: De Villiers on Kohli ahead of Asia Cup
21.article_body: Ex-SA wicketkeeper-batter AB De Villiers has said Virat Kohli doesn't need anyone to tell him to work hard to come out of his poor form. "Form is temporary, class is permanent...Virat and I remain in regular contact. We're friends, and he certainly doesn't need me to tell him the importance of working hard during a bad patch," stated De Villiers.

22.title: Sisodia deserves Bharat Ratna instead CBI raid conducted against him: Kejriwal
22.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said his deputy Manish Sisodia deserves the "Bharat Ratna". "He (Manish Sisodia) reformed government schools which other parties could not do in 70 years. Such a person should get Bharat Ratna," Kejriwal added. "The entire country's education system should be handed over to him but instead, they conducted CBI raid against him," he stated.

23.title: Pune Rural Police arrest man for raping 16-year-old
23.article_body: A man was arrested by the Pune Rural Police for raping a 16-year-old girl, after her mother lodged a First Information Report (FIR), officials said. The accused, aged 25, was booked on rape charges under the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Prevention of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. The police also added that the accused and victim are neighbours.

24.title: Assailants on a bike shoot 27-yr-old man in broad daylight in Pune
24.article_body: Two motorcycle-borne assailants shot down a 27-year-old conservancy truck worker in broad daylight, in Pune city's Chandan Nagar area, the police said. The deceased, identified as Akshay Prakash Bhise, was killed while he was on his way to work. Police officials said that efforts are on to arrest the accused, and the area's CCTV footage is being checked for clues.

25.title: She was harassed, didn't imagine this: Dad of UP woman who's body was found
25.article_body: Days after the body of a 25-year old woman was found on a railway track in Uttar Pradesh, the father of the deceased said that she was being harassed for dowry after her wedding. "We tried to settle the issue...we had not imagined that they would kill her by throwing her before a moving train," he said.

26.title: Largest shipment of fentanyl seized in Australia; 5 million doses recovered
26.article_body: Australian Federal Police (AFP) in a joint operation with Australian Border Force (ABF) have seized the largest shipment of fentanyl ever detected in the country and recovered over five million doses of the opioid, ABF said in a statement on Monday. Over 11 kg of pure fentanyl and about 30 kg of methamphetamine were hidden in the shipment, it added.

27.title: Standup comedians, Hyd-linked traders being probed in Delhi liquor scam: Report
27.article_body: Standup comedians, Hyderabad-linked wholesale and retail traders and corporate entities sharing similar Mumbai addresses are being probed in alleged Delhi liquor licensing scam, reports quoted officials as saying. CBI, after conducting searches in locations including Mumbai, Delhi and Hyderabad, filed FIR against 15 people, two companies and "other unknown public servants and private persons".

28.title: Workers in Argentina hold 'funeral' for their wages, pics surface
28.article_body: Several workers in Argentina held a protest demanding government action to boost salaries and unemployment benefits amid higher inflation. They held a symbolic funeral for their wages. "The paycheck has died," read a banner, while another placard read, "RIP the minimum wage". The country’s official monthly minimum wage stands at 45,540 Argentine pesos ($334).

29.title: I don't need to react: Sonam on being trolled for maternity photoshoot
29.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor has opened up about being trolled for her maternity photoshoot and said, "I think...one thing I've grown out of is reacting to things I don't need to react to." "I come from a place of extreme privilege and [I've]...nothing to complain about, so if someone is saying something...from behind a keyboard, [it's]...none of my business," she added.

30.title: I'm not 20, it won't take me anywhere: Meera on doing Kubbra's Sacred Games role
30.article_body: Actress Meera Chopra has stated that she would not be open to doing Kubbra Sait's role of a trans-woman in 'Sacred Games'. "I'm not 20 anymore, I'm not at the age where I would imagine that such a thing would take me somewhere," she said. The actress added that she has also refused offers over being asked to kiss onscreen.

31.title: CWG gold medallist Lakshya enters 2nd round at World Championships 2022
31.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler Lakshya Sen entered the second round at World Championships 2022 after defeating HK Solberg Vittinghus of Denmark 21-12, 21-11 in Tokyo on Monday. Ninth-seeded Lakshya, who won a bronze medal in the last edition, ended the match in 35 minutes. Earlier, 2019 bronze medallist Sai Praneeth lost in the first round.

32.title: Are other castes of compromising nature?: Agnihotri on Sisodia's remarks
32.article_body: Film director Vivek Agnihotri criticised Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia for his "I am a Rajput" remark. Sharing Sisodia’s statement, he tweeted, "Does this mean had he not been a Rajput, he would have given in? So what about those people in Delhi who are Brahmins, Yadavs, Gujjars, Jats, Sikhs, etc? Are they all of a compromising nature?"

33.title: 1 arrested, 50 booked for assaulting police at concert venue in Kerala
33.article_body: One person has been arrested and 50 others have been booked for assaulting policemen after they shut down a concert at a Kerala beach on Sunday. Police said the venue could not accommodate all the attendees which created a disturbance and overcrowding. Six policemen and 30 members of the public were injured after the accused threw stones and beer bottles.

34.title: Shubman smashes highest-ever ODI score by an Indian in Zimbabwe, breaks Sachin's record
34.article_body: India's 22-year-old opener Shubman Gill on Monday smashed the highest-ever score in ODI cricket by an Indian in Zimbabwe. Shubman scored 130 runs off 97 deliveries, including 15 fours and a six, in the third ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare. The previous record was held by Sachin Tendulkar, who had smashed 127* runs off 130 deliveries in Bulawayo in 1998.

35.title: Blessing in disguise: Snapdeal CEO on old email saying his US visa was rejected
35.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl shared a 15-year-old email stating his application for H1-B visa in 2007 was rejected by the US government. "I returned to India and couldn't be more thankful that this happened to me," Bahl tweeted. Calling it a "blessing in disguise", he said he got the chance to start his own company, Snapdeal, in his own country.

36.title: Sikh girl abducted, raped and forcibly converted to Islam in Pakistan
36.article_body: A Sikh girl named Dina Kaur was abducted and forcibly converted to Islam on Saturday in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan, ANI reported. She was reported to be abducted on gunpoint, raped and married to her abductor with the help of local administration and police, ANI added. Sikh community in Buner blocked roads and organised massive protests after the incident.

37.title: Cricketers react as Shubman Gill smashes his 1st ODI ton
37.article_body: Reacting to Team India opener Shubman Gill's first-ever hundred in international cricket, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "First of many...for this youngster, well done." Veteran batter Robin Uthappa wrote, "Shubman played some gun shots with panache!! An absolute delight to watch." Shubman scored 130 off 97 deliveries as India posted 289/8 against Zimbabwe in the third ODI.

38.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan gets protective bail in terrorism case
38.article_body: Islamabad High Court has granted former Pakistan PM Imran Khan protective bail till Thursday after he was booked under the anti-terror act for allegedly threatening two top police officials and a magistrate. This comes after Khan's lawyers filed a petition seeking pre-arrest bail. The petition stated that Khan was a "target of the ruling PDM (Pakistan Democratic Movement)", reported Dawn.

39.title: 'This is a good omen': Alia recalls Gadot's husband's reaction to her pregnancy
39.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who's expecting her first child with Ranbir Kapoor, spoke about how her 'Heart of Stone' co-star Gal Gadot and her husband Jaron Varsano reacted to her pregnancy. She said Gal had a "lovely reaction" while Jaron called it "a good omen". "Jaron was like, 'This is a good omen...everything's gonna go really well, it's lovely for...movie'," Alia said.

40.title: B'luru sees decline in daily COVID-19 caseload, logs 273 new cases
40.article_body: Bengaluru added 273 new cases to its COVID-19 tally with a positivity rate of 6.06% in the last 24 hours, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief informed on Sunday. The city had recorded as many as 965 cases on the previous day. According to data shared by the BBMP chief on Sunday, Bengaluru's active caseload stood at 7,251.

41.title: Request passengers to vote for AAP: Kejriwal to bus drivers in Gujarat
41.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal has asked bus drivers and conductors in Gujarat to request passengers to vote for AAP in the upcoming Assembly elections to bring a change. He also said, "We're guaranteeing that we'll provide free and best health treatment to all Gujaratis...Mohalla clinics and health clinics will be opened in cities and villages."

42.title: History-sheeter injured in encounter with Ghaziabad Police
42.article_body: Ghaziabad Police arrested a man wanted in multiple robbery and attempted murder cases on Sunday following an encounter. The accused tried escaping the site of a routine checking, police said. In the ensuing encounter, he was shot in the leg, as per police. It was revealed during investigation that he is a member of the Deepak Agrola gang, police added.

43.title: WI ruled 2 overs short of target in 3rd NZ ODI, players fined 40% of match fee
43.article_body: West Indies players have been fined 40% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against New Zealand in the third and final ODI. The sanctions were imposed by match referee Richie Richardson on the hosts, who lost the game by five wickets. With the win, New Zealand also won the three-match ODI series 2-1.

44.title: BJP's 'modus operandi' to topple govts is using central agencies: AAP's Atishi
44.article_body: AAP leader Atishi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and BJP’s "modus operandi" to topple governments is to use central agencies. "They first use these agencies...CBI, ED...to lodge cases against leaders (of Opposition parties)…BJP reaches those leaders and offers them to join…party with the promise to close all cases against them," Atishi added.

45.title: Andhra CM Jagan Mohan Reddy meets PM Narendra Modi in Delhi
45.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy met PM Narendra Modi at his residence today in the national capital. This is his second meeting with the PM in the last three months. He is also expected to meet some of the Union Ministers. He met the PM earlier this year and discussed about many projects including Polavaram, Kadapa Steel Plant, etc.

46.title: Dehradun Police team leaves for Gurugram to arrest Bobby Kataria
46.article_body: A Dehradun Police team has left for Gurugram to arrest social media influencer Bobby Kataria for allegedly having liquor on a road by blocking traffic last month. The police will move court for confiscation of Kataria's property if he is not found, an official said. He added that two notices had already been issued to Kataria earlier this month.

47.title: Ease of doing drug business: Rahul to PM Modi on Guj drug hauls
47.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi on Monday over multiple drug busts from Gujarat and asked for how long he would be silent on the matter. "Drugs worth thousands of crores are reaching Gujarat. Who is spreading this poison in the holy land of Gandhi-Patel," Gandhi said in a tweet in Hindi.

48.title: Mobile phone charger explodes, catches fire in MP; 4-year-old boy injured
48.article_body: A mobile phone charger exploded in the hands of a 4-year-old boy and got stuck in his hand after he grabbed the phone which was charging in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur. The charger got stuck in the boy's fingers and caught fire after the explosion. The child is undergoing treatment and has suffered severe burn injuries on his hand.

49.title: Gunmen kidnapped 4 Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria: Convent
49.article_body: A local convent said on Monday that gunmen have kidnapped four Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria's Imo. The convent's secretary general said that the abducted nuns had been travelling from Rivers to Imo for a thanksgiving mass. Earlier in June, a lawmaker had said that at least 50 people were killed after gunmen attacked a church in Ondo.

50.title: All the rumours about Kartik Aaryan hiking his fee are baseless: Director
50.article_body: A Bollywood director, who is working with Kartik Aaryan on an upcoming project, has refuted the reports claiming that the 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' actor has hiked up his fee. "Kartik is a very grounded guy in reality...All the rumours about him hiking his fee are baseless," the director on the condition of anonymity said. Kartik will next feature in 'Shehzada'.

51.title: Pune NCP protests over reservation in govt jobs for Govindas
51.article_body: The Pune NCP on Monday staged a protest against Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's announcement over reservation in government jobs for Dahi Handi participants. The protesters said this will be an injustice to those preparing for government jobs. Last week, the CM announced that Govindas playing Dahi Handi will be eligible for government jobs under the 5% sports quota.

52.title: Hyderabad Police to increase number of patrolling vehicles
52.article_body: The Hyderabad Police will be increasing the number of patrolling vehicles at Banjara Hills and Jubilee Hills police stations to reduce the emergency response time due to high number of dial 100 calls received from these areas. The police stations having larger jurisdictions have also been allotted extra quota of fuel for patrol vehicles, Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said.

53.title: K Kavitha to file defamation case after BJP leaders call her AAP-liquor mafia middleman
53.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and MLC K Kavitha said that she will file defamation case against Delhi BJP leaders Parvesh Verma and Manjinder Singh Sirsa after they said that she acted as a "middleman" between liquor mafia and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government. "I don't have any link...with what was said in...Delhi Excise scam," K Kavitha said.

54.title: Wrong judgement of driver: BJP's Fadnavis on ex-MLC's accident
54.article_body: Days after former MLC Vinayak Mete died in a car crash on Mumbai-Pune Expressway, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that it was an "utterly wrong judgement" of Mete's driver. The 52-year-old Shiv Sangram party leader was killed after his car hit a truck on August 14. Police had said that Mete's driver was trying to overtake a truck.

55.title: BJP offered me CM post if I break AAP: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia
55.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday alleged that BJP offered him the Chief Minister's post if he broke AAP. He claimed that someone came to him with two offers from BJP. Sisodia added that he was told that all big cases registered against him by CBI and ED would be taken back if he quit AAP and joined BJP.

56.title: Radhakishan Damani likely to be main trustee of Jhunjhunwala's estate: Report
56.article_body: DMart's billionaire owner Radhakishan Damani is likely to be the main trustee of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's estate, Moneycontrol reported. Damani is said to have the final say in the main publicly listed investments of Jhunjhunwala. The investor, who passed away last week, reportedly left his assets, including investments in listed and unlisted firms, mainly to his wife and children.

57.title: Sensex plunges over 870 points to close at 58,773, Nifty ends below 17,500
57.article_body: Sensex on Monday plunged by 872 points to close at 58,773, whereas the Nifty was down 267 points to settle below 17,500, marking the second consecutive decline for the benchmark indices. Shares of ITC, Coal India, Tata Consumer Products, Nestle India and Britannia Industries were among top Nifty gainers. Meanwhile, Tata Steel, Asian Paints, Adani Ports were among major losers.

58.title: Chiranjeevi is ageless megastar, has same pace & grace: 'Bholaa...' director
58.article_body: Filmmaker Meher Ramesh has said that directing actor Chiranjeevi in 'Bholaa Shankar' was a dream come true for him. "Chiranjeevi is an ageless megastar...No other actor or star has this kind of stardom even after all these years," he added. "Even now he is acting as a lead actor...he is doing it with the same grace and speed," he stated.

59.title: Rhea shares pics of herself crying on seeing Sonam Kapoor’s newborn
59.article_body: Rhea Kapoor on Monday introduced Instagram to her 'nephew' and Sonam Kapoor-Anand Ahuja's son, who was born on August 20. Rhea shared photos of herself in which she can be seen crying at the sight of her newborn nephew. Calling Sonam "the bravest mommy" and Anand "the most loving dad", Rhea described the moment as "unreal".

60.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' goes on floors, Akshay is first guest: Reports
60.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma has reportedly started shooting for the new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', which he announced on Sunday. As per reports, Kapil is shooting the first episode with Akshay Kumar, who will be promoting his upcoming film 'Cuttputlli' on the show. Along with Akshay, the episode will reportedly feature Rakul Preet Singh and Sargun Mehta.

61.title: KCR’s family attended meetings on formulation of Delhi excise policy: BJP MP
61.article_body: BJP MP Parvesh Verma has claimed that Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's family members attended meetings on the formulation of the Delhi excise policy at a hotel. "KCR's family members got the same policy implemented in Punjab. They prepared a plan for Delhi along with Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal," Verma added.

62.title: 55-yr-old kills 11-yr-old girl for reporting his misbehaviour in B'luru
62.article_body: A 55-year-old man killed his 11-year-old neighbour, allegedly after she reported his misbehaviour, before stabbing himself to death in Bengaluru on Sunday, police said. The accused had blocked the girl when she was going down the stairs, following which he had been asked to move out, officers said. He stabbed her after failing to find a place for rent.

63.title: KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant could be India's all-format captains in future: Karim
63.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has named KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant as the players who can become India's all-format captain in the future. "For how long Rohit can continue given his injury woes? So, these things also have to be kept in mind," added Karim. Rahul captained India in a Test and three ODIs against South Africa earlier this year.

64.title: 22-year-old Shubman Gill smashes his first-ever hundred in international cricket
64.article_body: Team India opener Shubman Gill on Monday smashed his first-ever hundred in international cricket. The 22-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 82 deliveries against Zimbabwe in the third ODI. Shubman, who made his international debut in an ODI in 2019, took 30 international innings to record his maiden international ton.

65.title: Shubman breaks Rohit's record, becomes youngest Indian to smash a hundred in Zimbabwe
65.article_body: Opener Shubman Gill has become the youngest-ever Indian to smash a hundred in international cricket on Zimbabwean soil. Gill slammed a hundred in the third ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare aged 22 years and 348 days. He broke the record set by Rohit Sharma, who had slammed an ODI ton in Zimbabwe aged 23 years and 28 days.

66.title: I've made sure I'm the one paying for kids' education: Twinkle Khanna
66.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna has said that she has always made sure that she is the one paying for her children's education. "I want them to say that my mother paid for my education and not just fed me aloo parathas," she added. Twinkle further revealed she never had a joint account with her husband and actor Akshay Kumar.

67.title: Garcia becomes first-ever qualifier to win WTA 1000 title at Cincinnati Open
67.article_body: Unseeded Caroline Garcia beat two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova 6-2, 6-4 to win Cincinnati Open title on Sunday and became the first-ever qualifier to win a WTA 1000 title. "Don't know how to describe that week because I came here on Wednesday night to get ready for qualifiers," said Garcia. Garcia beat three top-10 opponents en route to the final.

68.title: B'day wishes to my brother whom I love, respect: Pawan to Chiranjeevi
68.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Pawan Kalyan wished actor Chiranjeevi on his 67th birthday. "My wholehearted birthday wishes to my beloved brother whom I love, respect and adore," he tweeted. "Wishing you good health, success and glory on this special day," he added. Chiranjeevi will next feature in 'GodFather'.

69.title: Paine returns to Tasmania team after break over sexting scandal
69.article_body: Ex-Australian Test captain Tim Paine is reportedly set to make his competitive cricket comeback in the upcoming Sheffield Shield season. Cricket Tasmania CEO Dom Baker has confirmed that Paine has been training with the state squad. Paine had resigned from captaincy and had taken an indefinite break from all cricket amid his 'd**k pic' scandal last year.

70.title: Man kills 33-year-old wife in front of children over dowry in Hyd
70.article_body: A man killed his 33-year-old wife in front of their children in Hyderabad's Uppal district over a dowry dispute. The deceased had lodged a complaint a few years back and the police helped the couple reconcile. The accused, after having fought with his wife over the same issue, killed her in front of their children and escaped.

71.title: 68,000 candidates register for Agniveer rally at Army's Pune office
71.article_body: As many as 68,000 candidates have registered at the Pune office of the Indian Army for the second Agniveer recruitment rally. The rally is being organised at Mahatma Phule Krishi Vidyapeeth at Rahuri in Ahmednagar from August 23 (Tuesday) to September 11. A daily footfall of around 5,000 candidates is expected, Army officials said.

72.title: US is procrastinating talks to revive 2015 nuclear deal: Iran
72.article_body: Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Nasser Kanaani on Monday accused the US of "procrastinating" indirect talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal and said that there is "inaction" from the European sides. Adding that the agreement is needed more by the US and Europe than Iran, he also stated that Tehran wanted a "sustainable deal that would preserve its legitimate rights".

73.title: Comedian Kapil Sharma makes ramp-walk debut at Beti Fashion Show
73.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma marked his debut on the ramp as he turned showstopper for Anu Ranjan's Beti Fashion Show over the weekend. Kapil was dressed in a black puff-sleeve jacket, which was paired with black pants featuring gold patchwork. A video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani shows Kapil walking the ramp and also imitating female models at the end.

74.title: 2019 bronze medallist Praneeth crashes out of World Championships 2022
74.article_body: Sai Praneeth crashed out of World Championships 2022 in Tokyo after losing in first round on Monday. The 2019 bronze medallist lost to fourth-seeded Chou Tien Chen 15-21, 21-15, 15-21. In women's doubles, Indian duo of Ashwini Ponnappa and Sikki Reddy entered second round with a 21-7, 21-9 win over Maldives' Aminath Nabeeha Abdul Razzaq and Fathimath Nabaaha Abdul Razzaq.

75.title: Akasa Air operates 2 flights daily between Bengaluru & Mumbai
75.article_body: Newly-launched Akasa Air has started operating flights between Bengaluru and Mumbai twice daily. The budget carrier currently operates from Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Kochi and Mumbai. The first Akasa Air flight operated between Mumbai and Ahmedabad on August 7 this year and it also began operations from Bengaluru to Kochi on August 12.

76.title: SC stays Delhi HC order to file FIR against Shahnawaz Hussain in rape case
76.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday stayed a Delhi High Court order to register a First Information Report (FIR) against BJP leader Syed Shahnawaz Hussain in a 2018 rape complaint. "We are prima facie of the view that the matter requires consideration. We will issue notice and stay all proceedings," a Bench led by Justice UU Lalit said.

77.title: Farmers stopped at Ghazipur border, allowed to proceed after due verification: Police
77.article_body: Some farmers who had gathered for protests in the national capital on Monday were stopped at the Ghazipur border, "in view of the heightened security measures and threat perception", police said. "However, after due verifications, all of them were allowed to proceed to their respective destinations," DCP (East district) Priyanka Kashyap added.

78.title: Euro falls to parity with US dollar for the second time this year
78.article_body: The euro briefly slipped below parity with the US dollar on Monday amid fear regarding recession in the euro zone. The currency was trading at exactly $1 after recovering marginally. This is the second time the euro has hit parity with dollar this year. In July, the euro reached parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years.

79.title: Philippine kids return to schools after 2 yrs as COVID-19 curbs ease
79.article_body: Millions of children returned to classrooms for their first in-person class as all schools were reopened in the Philippines on Monday after two years, as the country eased coronavirus restrictions. In November last year, the country had opened some schools in a pilot project to test in-person classes. Precautions like mandating face masks and temperature checks are in place.

80.title: Vodafone agrees to sell Hungarian unit for $1.8 billion
80.article_body: Britain's Vodafone has agreed to sell its Hungarian business for $1.8 billion in cash as part of its plan to simplify its business. The firm has sold its assets to 4iG Public and state-run Corvinus Zrt. The deal does not include Vodafone's shared services business VOIS and is expected to create Hungary's second largest telecoms operator.

81.title: Mike Tyson punched me by mistake, I had migraine for whole day: Vijay Deverakonda
81.article_body: Talking about boxing legend Mike Tyson who has made a cameo in his upcoming film 'Liger', actor Vijay Deverakonda said Tyson punched him by mistake during rehearsals. "I had migraine for the whole day...I didn’t get knocked out...but body wanted to fall down," he added. "I was worried when I saw his hands, his foot and his neck," he remarked.

82.title: Man shooting video with snake dies after reptile bites him in Uttar Pradesh
82.article_body: A man shooting a video with a snake in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur died after he was allegedly bitten by the reptile. The deceased was reportedly famous in the area for rescuing snakes and had caught more than 200 snakes in the village. The snake with which he was allegedly shooting the video, was caught from his neighbour's house, reports said.

83.title: Mumbai woman mistakenly consumes poison instead of stomach medicine, dies
83.article_body: A 24-year-old woman in Mumbai mistakenly consumed rat poison instead of medicine for stomach ache. She died a week later, police said. The incident took place on August 13 at around 9.30 pm. The deceased had called her mother to tell her that she was vomiting after consuming poison and that she needed help. She was taken to the hospital.

84.title: 'Hera Pheri' producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala passes away aged 91
84.article_body: Veteran producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala, who produced films like 'Hera Pheri' and 'Lahoo Ke Do Rang', passed away aged 91. He reportedly died due to cardiac arrest while being treated at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai. Mourning his demise, actor Ajay Devgn tweeted, "Deepest condolences...My father and he were associates during the golden era of our cinema."

85.title: I guess I was too relaxed to lose, it cost me: Tsitsipas on Cincinnati Open final
85.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas has said he was "too relaxed" against Borna Coric in the final of the Cincinnati Open. "Coric was obviously the opposite of what I was...Sometimes it makes you not be that much present in the moment when you're too relaxed. It takes away that momentum that you are trying to capture," added Tsitsipas.

86.title: Sanjay Raut’s custody extended till September 5 in land scam case
86.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court extended the judicial custody of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut till September 5 in the Patra Chawl land scam case. The Enforcement Directorate stated that releasing Raut at this time will hamper the investigation since he has great influence and it is possible that he will tamper with the evidence.

87.title: Ford ordered to pay $1.7 billion over pickup truck crash that killed US couple
87.article_body: A jury has ordered Ford Motor to pay $1.7 billion after a US couple was killed in a pickup truck crash in 2014. The couple died after a tyre blew out on a local highway and their 2002 Ford Super Duty F-250 pickup rolled over. Following the crash, the couple's children sued Ford alleging the pickup had a weak roof.

88.title: We're working on the script: Jennifer Grey on 'Dirty Dancing' sequel
88.article_body: Actress Jennifer Grey, speaking about the 'Dirty Dancing' sequel said, "I can't tell you much...but I'll tell you that it will involve Baby (her character in the film)." She further added that they are working on the script for the sequel. She added, "We're going to shoot it in the spring of 2023...it comes out on February 9, 2024."

89.title: 5-km-long jam at Delhi-Noida border due to police checking; pics surface
89.article_body: A five-kilometre-long traffic jam was seen at Noida-Delhi Link Road at Chilla Border amid checking of vehicles by police personnel in wake of farmers' protests in the national capital today. Huge traffic snarls were also reported on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, NH-9 and DND flyway. Delhi Traffic Police said that they have deployed additional traffic personnel to handle the situation.

90.title: Slaves of Gujarat: KTR shares video of BJP leader fetching Amit Shah's sandals
90.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao shared a video in which Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar is seen fetching sandals of Union Home Minister Amit Shah when the latter visited a temple in the state. Reacting to it, Rao said that the people of Telangana are watching the "slaves of Gujarat" and will reverse any attempt to denigrate Telangana's "self-respect".

91.title: Priyanka Gandhi should campaign across India: Hanumantha Rao
91.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said that party's General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra should campaign across the country and not only stick to Uttar Pradesh. "If Rahul Gandhi is not available, she should also visit south India to strengthen the party at the ground level," said Rao. He further added that Priyanka should contest from Medak constituency like her grandmother.

92.title: GHMC likely to convert Sardar Mahal into a museum: Reports
92.article_body: According to reports, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will convert Sardar Mahal into a museum which will display the history of the area. The GHMC is scheduled to meet on August 29 where it is likely to give a nod to the proposal. It is located near Charminar and is one of the historical monuments in Hyderabad.

93.title: 16 trauma care centres set up in Hyderabad
93.article_body: Telangana government has set up 16 trauma care centres and 10 advance life support ambulances on the Outer Ring Road of Hyderabad. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao appealed to people to spread the word about the life-saving trauma care facility. The government also issued new toll-free numbers (1066/1059102) which can be used during any emergency.

94.title: Man rapes & murders 8-yr-old in Delhi, dumps her body in Yamuna
94.article_body: A 36-year-old butcher has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly kidnapping an 8-year-old girl while she was sleeping at her house, raping her, slitting her throat and dumping her body in the Yamuna. The post-mortem revealed that the accused also disfigured the victim's face using a sharp weapon to destroy her identity. The victim's parents work as labourers.

95.title: Tesla's Autopilot averts 40 crashes/day caused by sudden acceleration: Exec
95.article_body: Tesla's Autopilot Software Director Ashok Elluswamy has said that the firm's Autopilot prevents around 40 crashes per day that would have been caused by sudden unintended acceleration (SUA). He shared instances where drivers misapplied the pedals and were saved by Autopilot. He even shared a video in which he claims the Autopilot saved a man's legs from getting injured.

96.title: 4 members of family killed after car falls into gorge in Himachal
96.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after their car skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba on Sunday. The victims were identified as Chamba head post office's postal superintendent Tilak Raj, his wife and teenage children. Villagers said they heard a bang and rushed to the spot but the victims had already passed.

97.title: Islamic State suicide bomber plotting to attack Indian leader detained in Russia
97.article_body: The Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) has said that its officers have detained a suicide bomber, a member of the Islamic State terrorist group, who was plotting an attack in India. Russia said that he "planned to commit a terrorist act by blowing himself up against one of the representatives of the ruling circles of India".

98.title: Thankless task: Russian minister on speculating strategic talks with US
98.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov has said that the possibility of the resumption of strategic talks with US "is far from obvious" given the "recklessly aggressive" policy that Washington is pursuing towards Moscow. Moreover, he added that speculating about prospects for strategic dialogue with US, "especially in the conditions when the Americans broke it off, is a thankless task."

99.title: Sajad Lone warns of hunger strike over voting rights to outsiders in J&K
99.article_body: J&K People’s Conference President Sajad Lone commented on the matter of inclusion of outsiders in J&K electoral rolls. "If we feel there is demographic intervention or the rights of the people of J&K are compromised, then we will sit on hunger strike in front of Parliament in Delhi," Lone said. "We're scared of those implementing the law," he added.

100.title: Farooq Abdullah holds all-party meet over 'inclusion of non-local voters' in J&K
100.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Monday held an all-party meeting regarding the "inclusion of non-locals as voters" in J&K at his residence in Srinagar. Meanwhile, J&K People's Conference President Sajad Lone opted out of the meeting. "If this effort (all party meeting) was serious, it would not be held under media gaze," Lone said.

101.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie designed to create regime of fear: IMSD
101.article_body: The Indian Muslims for Secular Democracy (IMSD) condemned the attack on 'The Satanic Verses' writer Salman Rushdie and questioned the silence of Muslim organisations. IMSD said in a statement that the attack was designed to create a regime of fear. It added that the silence of Muslims emboldens "Islamophobes to paint the religion as a creed of violence and terror".

102.title: Video shows mob climbing building to catch Hindu man over fake blasphemy case in Pak
102.article_body: A Hindu man in Pakistan was booked in a fake blasphemy case over alleged desecration of Quran, reports said. A video shows hundreds of people around an apartment building and some climbing the building to get hold of Ashok Kumar. The video shows police dispersing the mob by lathicharging. Reports added that a Muslim woman had actually burned the Quran.

103.title: No place for Manish Sisodia in BJP: Parvesh Verma
103.article_body: Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Verma reacted to Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claim that the BJP had offered to "shut all cases" against him if he quit AAP and crossed over. "Sisodia is not welcomed in BJP and he has no place here," Verma said. Not only BJP but no other party should allow Sisodia to join them, he added.

104.title: FTX's revenue jumped by more than 1,000% in a year, leaked documents show
104.article_body: The revenue of privately held crypto exchange FTX surged more than 1,000% from $89 million in 2020 to $1.02 billion in 2021, according to leaked internal documents. Further, its operating income was $272 million in 2021, up from $14 million a year earlier. FTX saw net income of $388 million last year, up from just $17 million a year earlier.

105.title: Musk lists main goals for Tesla & SpaceX for 2022, says 'will require insane work'
105.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk took to Twitter on Monday to share his two main goals for this year. He said that sending SpaceX's Starship rocket to the Earth's orbit and a wide release of Tesla's full-self driving software are the "two giant kahunas". Musk further noted that the goals will require "insane work by many super talented people".

106.title: It's in his own hands: Shahid Afridi on Kohli's future ahead of Asia Cup
106.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, ex-Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi was asked about Virat Kohli's future. "It's in his own hands," replied Afridi. The former all-rounder was also asked about his views on Kohli's century drought in international cricket since 2019. "Only tough times can unearth big players," said Afridi. Kohli will return to competitive cricket at the Asia Cup.

107.title: 3 policemen kneel on man & repeatedly kick, punch his face in US; suspended
107.article_body: Three police officers have been suspended in US' Arkansas after a video showing them beating up an alleged suspect went viral. The video shows the officers kneeling on him before punching his face and kicking him repeatedly. One of the officers was also seen slamming his head onto the ground. According to police, the man had assaulted an officer first.

108.title: Massive setback for Pakistan: Inzamam on Shaheen getting ruled out of Asia Cup
108.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that pacer Shaheen Afridi's absence from Asia Cup is a "massive setback" for the Babar Azam-led side. "If you look at the last match against India, Shaheen created pressure right from the very first over," added Inzamam. Shaheen had dismissed KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in their T20 World Cup match last year.

109.title: Teen who was pursuing rape case found dead in canal in UP
109.article_body: The body of a 17-year-old girl was recovered in a canal in UP's Barabanki district on Saturday after she went missing on August 18. The victim told her parents that she is going to meet her lawyer to discuss a rape case she lodged in January. Police suspect she died by suicide and her body has been sent for postmortem.

110.title: SC terminates CoA set up to manage All India Football Federation
110.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has dissolved the Committee of Administrators (CoA) that was set up to manage All India Football Federation (AIFF). The SC said it is passing the order to facilitate revocation of suspension of AIFF by FIFA and holding of Under-17 FIFA World Cup in India as well as allowing participation of teams from India in international events.

111.title: Allu Arjun & Rashmika Mandanna-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rule' goes on floors
111.article_body: The shooting of Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rule' began on Monday. Taking to Instagram, the makers of the film said that they will hold a pooja ceremony on Monday and added, "Pushpa Raj is back! This time to Rule." The film also features Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil. The sequel to the 2021 film will be directed by Sukumar.

112.title: Bumped into each other in lift, was lovely meeting him: Papon on Mohanlal
112.article_body: Singer Papon has said that it was "lovely meeting" actor Mohanlal and called him "a great and humble artist". He added, "We bumped [into] each other in the lift...he came to my room and I hosted him with a warm welcome in my state." Speaking about meeting Mohanlal, Papon further said that it felt like meeting an elder brother.

113.title: Railways to ply 6 Ganpati special trains between Mumbai and Mangaluru
113.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) announced that it will run six additional Ganpati special trains between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and Mangaluru Junction to manage the rush of passengers during the festive season. Earlier, the Central Railway announced running of 212 Ganpati specials. With the introduction of six additional trains, the total number of Ganpati specials this year will be 218.

114.title: MSP is not being implemented because PM has a friend whose name is Adani: Satya Pal Malik
114.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik on Sunday said, "The MSP is not being implemented because Prime Minister has a friend whose name is Adani, who at the moment has become Asia's richest person in five years." He added, "You cannot defeat the farmer. You cannot scare him...since you cannot send ED or Income-Tax officers, how will you scare the farmer?"

115.title: Pak army truck plunges into ravine in PoK; 9 killed, 4 injured
115.article_body: At least nine Pakistani soldiers were killed and four others injured after an army truck they were travelling in plunged into a ravine in Shaujabad area in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) on Sunday. According to the Pakistan army's media wing Inter-Services Public Relations, the incident occurred during routine military duty, Geo TV reported. The injured soldiers were taken to a hospital.

116.title: IMD issues red alert for heavy rainfall in 39 districts of Madhya Pradesh
116.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red alert for heavy rainfall in 39 districts of Madhya Pradesh. Red alert has been issued in districts including Bhopal, Ujjain, Jabalpur, Ratlam, Neemuch and Mandsaur. Moderate rainfall has also been predicted in 12 districts including Indore, Gwalior, Dhar and Khargone. Schools in Narmadapuram and Bhopal have been shut in view of heavy rains.

117.title: Switzerland's Credit Suisse appoints Dixit Joshi as Chief Financial Officer
117.article_body: Switzerland's second-biggest bank Credit Suisse on Monday announced the appointment of Dixit Joshi as its new Chief Financial Officer. Joshi will take over on October 1, replacing David Mathers who previously announced he is stepping down. Joshi joins Credit Suisse from Deutsche Bank after nearly 12 years. He served as the German bank's Group Treasurer in his last role.

118.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd ODI against Zimbabwe
118.article_body: Team India captain KL Rahul won the toss for the third time in the row and elected to bat first against Zimbabwe in the third ODI in Harare. India have made two changes to their playing XI with Deepak Chahar and Avesh Khan replacing Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna. Zimbabwe have also made two changes to their playing XI.

119.title: Disha Patani is still among few I'd call if I need help: Krishna Shroff
119.article_body: Tiger Shroff's sister Krishna Shroff has said that actress Disha Patani is "one of the first few people" she would call if she needed help. "I know she'd be there. In a world, where women are constantly pulling each other down, she and I are the opposite," she added. This comes after Disha and Tiger reportedly ended their relationship.

120.title: Stardom is just a by-product: Pranay on Kareena's OTT actors remark
120.article_body: Speaking about actress Kareena Kapoor's OTT actors remark, actor Pranay Singh Pachauri stated that stardom is just the by-product of acting. Kareena had said that OTT actors have shown stars their standing. "Whatever Kareena ma'am has seen, none of us have even touched it. It takes a lot of courage and being down to earth to...say that," the actor added.

121.title: Big Tech's India executives to depose before Parliamentary panel
121.article_body: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Finance has asked Indian executives of tech giants like Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, Google and Netflix to testify on Tuesday. The meeting will address the 'anti-competitive practices by big tech companies', a notice by the Lok Sabha Secretariat said. Tech giants are facing a probe by the Competition Commission of India over alleged anti-competitive practices.

122.title: Landslide hits Shi'ite Muslim shrine in Iraq; 4 dead, 6 rescued
122.article_body: At least four people were killed and six survivors were pulled out from the rubble after a landslide hit a Shi'ite Muslim shrine in Iraq's Karbala, the health ministry said on Sunday. The search and rescue operation is ongoing, the ministry added. Preliminary information suggests that the incident occurred due to humidity, a statement by the civil defence service said.

123.title: People angry over CBI action against Sisodia, joining AAP: Kejriwal
123.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said a large number of people are joining AAP as there is "a lot of anger" among them over CBI action against Manish Sisodia. "Every morning, they wake up and start the CBI, ED game…How will country progress like this?" asked Kejriwal. His remark came after CBI conducted a raid at Sisodia's residence.

124.title: 8-month pregnant woman critical after being assaulted in Kolkata
124.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman was hospitalised in Kolkata after a group of men allegedly kicked her abdomen, thrashed her family members, and ransacked their home over a real estate dispute. Police arrested seven attackers involved who were said to be supporters of TMC Beleghata MLA Paresh Paul. However, the MLA rubbished the charges that the attackers were his workers.

125.title: Google Maps users spot 'downed' plane in Australian forest; govt calls it 'ghost image'
125.article_body: A picture from Google Maps shared by its users appears to show a downed passenger plane in a rainforest in Australia. The Australian Transport Safety Bureau said that it was unaware of any missing passenger jets. "There appears to be a phenomenon called ghost images and that could be what this is," Australia's Civil Aviation Safety Authority said.

126.title: Google shut my account, flagged me for abuse over nude pics of my sick kid: US man
126.article_body: A San Francisco man has alleged that Google shut down his account after he used his Android smartphone to take photos of an infection on his child's groin. Google flagged those pictures as child sexual abuse material (CSAM), the man claimed, adding that the police had opened an investigation into him. The investigator ultimately decided that no crime had occurred.

127.title: Allu Arjun attends India Day parade in New York, shares pic with Mayor doing 'Pushpa' step
127.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun attended India Day parade in New York on Sunday, pictures and videos of which have surfaced online. He also shared a selfie with New York Mayor Eric Adams, showing both of them doing hand brush signature move from the film 'Pushpa'. "It was a pleasure meeting the Mayor of New York City. Very Sportive Gentleman," Arjun wrote.

128.title: I've to introduce myself but people chant Vijay's name everywhere: Ananya
128.article_body: Speaking about promoting her upcoming film 'Liger', actress Ananya Panday stated that she has to introduce herself wherever she goes because she is just starting out. "[My co-star] Vijay (Deverakonda) was also doing the same but he slowly realised that people already know him too well. They were chanting his name everywhere!" the actress added.

129.title: KCR bowed down before CPI to win by-polls: Revanth Reddy
129.article_body: Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee President Revanth Reddy alleged that Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao bowed down before the feet of the Communist Party of India (CPI) to win the upcoming by-elections in the Munugode Assembly constituency. He expressed his disappointment at the CPI leaders' choice to back the TRS party in the by-elections.

130.title: Every university has lunatic fringe, they can't define its identity: JNU VC
130.article_body: The Left has been dominant in JNU and they have done very good work but the problem comes when they say other narratives cannot exist, JNU VC Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said. "Every university has a lunatic fringe. There are troublemakers, they can be left, right, centre, anything but they cannot define the identity of the university," Pandit added.

131.title: Limit number of devotees, remove VIP enclosure: Mathura temple priests
131.article_body: The number of devotees inside Mathura's Bankey Bihari temple at a time should be restricted while the VIP enclosure should be removed, priests at the shrine said. The suggestions came a day after two persons died due to suffocation and six others were injured during Janmashtami celebrations. A new bigger temple should be constructed, ex-president of shrine's management committee said.

132.title: Bumrah won't be missed that much in the death overs at Asia Cup: Sanjay Bangar
132.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said pacer Jasprit Bumrah won't be missed "that much" in the death overs in the Aisa Cup. "Arshdeep...has a lot of control and an excellent temperament to bowl in the death overs," he stated. "One over where the team uses Bumrah in the middle overs, there his absence will definitely be felt," added Bangar.

133.title: Germany's Scholz heads to Canada with focus on energy talks
133.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz departed for a three-day visit to Canada to hold talks on energy security, Russian invasion of Ukraine and China. The two sides are expected to sign a long-term deal on close cooperation on renewable energies like green hydrogen. Scholz, joined by German Economy Minister and Vice Chancellor, will hold talks with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

134.title: BJP said break AAP and join BJP, will close all CBI, ED cases: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia
134.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday tweeted, "BJP's message has come to me - break AAP and join BJP, will get all CBI, ED cases closed." He added, "My reply to BJP - I am a Rajput, a descendant of Maharana Pratap. I will cut off my head but will not bow down in front of the corrupt-conspirators."

135.title: Train coach turned into restaurant with capacity of 70-75 in Raj's Barmer
135.article_body: A railway-themed restaurant inside a coach of a train will be opening soon at the Barmer railway station in Rajasthan, an official statement by North Western Railway said. Around 70 to 75 people will be able to sit inside the restaurant at a time. The surrounding area of the coach has also been developed for customers wishing to sit outside.

136.title: Dharamshala breaks heavy rainfall record in 64 yrs, 333 mm rain recorded in 12 hrs
136.article_body: Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala has broken the record of heavy rains in 64 years, Himachal Pradesh State Disaster Response Force said. "During the 12 hours from 9:00 pm on Friday to 9:00 am on Saturday, 333 mm of rain was recorded in Dharamshala. Earlier on 6 August, 1958, 316 mm of rain had fallen during 24 hours," the tweet read.

137.title: Coric beats Tsitsipas to become lowest-ranked player to claim a Masters Trophy
137.article_body: Croatia's Borna Coric created history by becoming the lowest-ranked player to claim a Masters Trophy after defeating Stefanos Tsitsipas to win the men's singles title at the Cincinnati Open. The world number 152 won the final with a scoreline of 7-6(7-0), 6-2. Coric returned to the ATP Tour in March after eight months on the sidelines with a shoulder injury.

138.title: Contradictory positions: Omar on Cong demanding Sisodia's resignation
138.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah criticised Congress' call for Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's resignation in connection with excise policy case. "I'm not disputing opportunistic politics of AAP...My limited point was about Congress' contradictory positions where investigative agencies are concerned," Omar tweeted. "How can agencies be...credible and discredited at same time?" he asked.

139.title: Zelenskyy warns Russia against putting Ukrainian soldiers on trial
139.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has warned Russia against putting its soldiers on trial, saying, "There are enough reports in...media that in Mariupol the scenery is being prepared for an absolutely disgusting and absurd show trial of Ukrainian defenders." He added that if this "despicable show trial takes place", this would be the line beyond which "any negotiations are impossible".

140.title: Delhi Air Traffic Controller tests positive for psychoactive substance, removed: Reports
140.article_body: An Air Traffic Controller at the Delhi airport has tested positive for a psychoactive substance and has been removed from duty by the aviation regulator DGCA, reports said. This is reportedly the first instance in the country of an ATC testing positive for a psychoactive substance after the rules for testing for psychoactive substances came into force in January 2022.

141.title: MBBS student found hanging dead in hostel in UP, CM orders probe
141.article_body: A first-year MBBS student was found hanging from the ceiling fan in his hostel room in Uttar Pradesh's Saifai Medical College on Saturday evening. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has ordered a probe asking the District Magistrate and Senior Superintendent of Police to submit a report on the student's death within 24 hours. No suicide note has been recovered yet.

142.title: Have solid blueprint on how to bring up my child with right values: Sonam
142.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child, has said she has a "solid blueprint" on how to bring up her children with the right values. Speaking about parenting, she said, "It comes from watching the way Dad and Mum brought us up...their motto was equal parenting." She added her parents are partners "in every sense of the word".

143.title: EAM Jaishankar unveils bust of Mahatma Gandhi in Paraguay
143.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday unveiled the bust of Mahatma Gandhi in Paraguay's Asuncion. He said that he appreciated the municipality's decision to locate the bust at the city's prominent waterfront and added, "This is a statement of solidarity that was so strongly expressed during the COVID-19 pandemic." Jaishankar is on a six-day visit to South America.

144.title: Mumbai's Prince Aly Khan Hospital shuts in-patient service after declared unsafe
144.article_body: Mumbai's Prince Aly Khan Hospital has decided to shut its in-patient admissions and surgeries after an independent structural audit found that despite regular and timely maintenance, the main building was unsafe for occupancy. The hospital has been in operation since 1945. It is a 170-bed multi-speciality hospital that caters to more than 1,70,000 outpatients and 9,000 in-patients annually.

145.title: Heavy traffic jam near Ghazipur border due to farmers' protest today
145.article_body: Massive traffic jam was seen at the Ghazipur border in Delhi on Monday morning as police have put up checkpoints at the border due to Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat at Jantar Mantar today. Meanwhile, slow traffic movement was also reported at the Noida-Delhi Link Road at Chilla Border as security is beefed up at the border entry point to Delhi.

146.title: Harsh Goenka shares viral pic of wedding invite printed in form of medicine packaging
146.article_body: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka shared a picture of a pharmacist's wedding invitation, which was printed in the form of medicine packaging. "People have become so innovative these days," Goenka wrote. The invite mentioned that the groom, B Ezhilarasan, is an Assistant Professor in a pharmacy college and the bride, M Vasanthakumari, is an Assistant Professor in a nursing college.

147.title: Death toll due to heavy rains, landslides rises to 27 in Himachal, several roads blocked
147.article_body: Death toll in Himachal Pradesh due to heavy rainfall and landslides has now risen to 27 after five more bodies were found. Several roads have also been damaged and blocked. Himachal Pradesh State Disaster Response Force took to Twitter to share updates about damaged roads in Kullu. Disaster Response Force shared video of machines working on damaged roads in Chamba.

148.title: US-S Korea begin biggest combined military training exercise in years
148.article_body: The US and South Korea have begun their biggest combined military training in years. The Ulchi Freedom Shield exercises reportedly include simulated joint attacks, front-line reinforcements of arms and fuel and removal of weapons of mass destruction. Last week, North Korea rejected South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's offer to make denuclearisation efforts in exchange for economic benefits.

149.title: Telangana Police are 'Razakar Police': T Raja after Faruqui's show
149.article_body: BJP leader Raja Singh criticised Telangana Police and called them "Razakar Police" for arresting BJP and BJYM leaders during Munawar Faruqui's show on Saturday. “The Hinduism in the police has died. They did not think their own Gods were insulted and all were busy providing security to a person, who insulted Lord Ram and Sita,” he said.

150.title: Shami can find a place in the XI for T20 WC if given chances: Karim
150.article_body: Ex-cricketer Saba Karim has said Mohammad Shami can surely find a place in Team India's playing XI for the T20 World Cup if pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who's currently undergoing rehabilitation at the NCA, is ruled out of the tournament. "Shami can surely find a place in the playing XI...if the selectors give him enough chances before the tournament," added Karim.

151.title: 7 houses damaged due to heavy rain in Himachal's Nurpur, families shifted
151.article_body: 7 houses were damaged due to heavy rains in Bariyara village of Nurpur in Himachal Pradesh on Sunday. The administration shifted the families to safe places, reports said. Meanwhile, death toll in Himachal Pradesh due to heavy rainfall and landslides has now risen to 27 after five more bodies were found. Several roads have also been damaged and blocked.

152.title: First made-in-India hydrogen fuel cell bus that only emits water unveiled in Pune
152.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh unveiled India's first indigenously developed hydrogen fuel cell bus in Pune on Sunday. The fuel cell utilises hydrogen and air to generate electricity to power the bus and the only effluent from the bus is water, Singh said. This possibly makes the hydrogen fuel cell bus the most environmentally friendly mode of transportation, the minister added.

153.title: India reports 9,531 new COVID-19 cases, active cases decline to 97,648
153.article_body: India has reported 9,531 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours including 10 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Health Ministry. Active cases in the country went down to 97,648, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.15%. India reported 11,726 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,37,23,944.

154.title: Working for India where children, youth get respect: BJP MP Varun Gandhi
154.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Sunday said he is working for an India where children and youth get respect and where nobody is compelled to bow his head for help. "Until employment ceases to exist in this country and your children don't get jobs, my 'sangharsh' (fight) will continue," Varun added while addressing a program in UP's Pilibhit.

155.title: Monkey snatches IAS officer's glasses in UP; video shows police trying to retrieve them
155.article_body: A monkey snatched and ran away with IAS officer and Mathura DM Navneet Chahal's spectacles in Vrindavan, a video of which is going viral on social media. Several police personnel could be seen trying to retrieve the glasses from the monkey without scaring it away and finally returning them to the DM in the video.

156.title: Manchester United should drop Ronaldo, Rashford from team: Wayne Rooney
156.article_body: Manchester United's record goal-scorer Wayne Rooney has urged manager Erik ten Hag to drop both Cristiano Ronaldo and Marcus Rashford from the team. "[Against Brentford] Ronaldo looked like he needs time to get match fit...he [also] wants to leave the club...I'd let him," stated Rooney. "Rashford looks like he wants to be anywhere but on a football pitch," he added.

157.title: Central Railway to intensify ticket-checking drive in Mumbai AC locals: Officials
157.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) officials said that they will soon start an intensive ticket-checking drive in Mumbai's AC locals. Last week (from August 18 to August 20), ticket-checkers caught 548 passengers travelling in AC locals without tickets and fined them ₹1.7 lakh. Currently, the number of passengers travelling in AC locals per day is over 38,000, another official said.

158.title: 20-yr-old stabbed to death in road rage incident in Chandigarh, 4 arrested
158.article_body: A 20-year-old man was stabbed to death by four men over a road rage incident in Chandigarh's Sector 17/22 dividing road on Sunday morning. All four accused were arrested within five hours. The victim and his two friends were returning home from a party when they encountered the accused driving on the wrong side leading to an altercation, police said.

159.title: Singapore will decriminalise sex between men: PM Lee Hsien Loong
159.article_body: Singapore's PM Lee Hsien Loong announced on Sunday that the government will repeal Section 377A, a colonial-era law, and decriminalise sex between men. However, he also proposed to amend the Constitution to protect the definition of marriage as being between a man and a woman. "Private sexual behaviour between consenting adults does not raise any law-and-order issue," he said.

160.title: 13 arrested in connection with stone pelting on Bihar CM's convoy in Patna
160.article_body: A total of 13 accused have been arrested in connection with stone-pelting at the convoy of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, SSP Patna said. Stones were pelted at the Chief Minister's convoy in the state capital on Sunday. Kumar was not present in the convoy at the time of the incident. The glasses of many vehicles were broken during incident.

161.title: Litigation is like bleeding wound: Justice Lalit on legal aid to poor
161.article_body: Litigation is like a bleeding wound and the more it's allowed to bleed, the more will the man suffer, Justice UU Lalit said. Over 70% of population is below the poverty line and only 12% opt for free legal aid provided by legal services authorities, he stated. He was formally launching the LADC system in 365 District Legal Services Authorities.

162.title: Gem of Telugu cinema: Home Minister Amit Shah after meeting Jr NTR
162.article_body: 'RRR' actor Jr NTR met Home Minister Amit Shah in Hyderabad on Sunday. Taking to Twitter, the Home Minister shared pictures of the interaction and wrote, "Had a good interaction with a very talented actor and the gem of our Telugu cinema, Jr NTR in Hyderabad." In response to the tweet, Jr NTR wrote, "It was a pleasure meeting you."

163.title: Govt blocked YouTube midway through my speech: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan
163.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday claimed that the government temporarily blocked YouTube midway through his speech. "This just shows the desperation of those who for their self interest are willing to push Pakistan towards political and economic chaos," he said. Earlier, Pakistan's media watchdog banned live broadcast of Khan's speeches after he threatened police officials and a magistrate.

164.title: Delhi Traffic Police issue advisory in view of Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat
164.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory in view of Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat at Jantar Mantar today. Taking to Twitter, the Delhi Traffic Police requested commuters to plan their journeys in advance. The police also shared a list of roads, including Tolstoy Marg, Sansad Marg, Ashoka Road and Pandit Pant Marg, that are likely to be congested today.

165.title: Organisers of public Ganeshotsav require prior permission from BBMP
165.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has allowed public Ganeshotsav celebrations in the city this year on the condition that the organisers of Ganeshotsav in public places will have to get no objection certificate (NOC) from BBMP beforehand. The civic body has decided to go ahead with a single-window agency to provide permission for organising Ganeshotsav, BBMP Chief Commissioner said.

166.title: Boy who left Lonavala home 8 months ago to escape abusive relatives found
166.article_body: A 12-year-old boy, who had gone missing from his Lonavala home eight months ago, has been found. Probe revealed he had left home because his paternal aunt and uncle used to beat him sometimes. He earlier told investigators that he was drugged and when he woke up, he was in Delhi. Process of reuniting him with his grandmother has started.

167.title: Security tightened in Delhi over farmer protest at Jantar Mantar
167.article_body: Delhi Police has tightened the security at Singhu border and Ghazipur border on the Delhi-Meerut expressway. The Samyukt Kisan Morcha has called for a ‘mahapanchayat’ at Delhi’s Jantar Mantar against unemployment in the country. It is expected to be attended by farmers from different states, however, Delhi Police said it has denied permission for the protest.

168.title: Zomato suspends its 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' membership programmes
168.article_body: Zomato has stopped onboarding new members and merchant partners to 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' programmes, the food delivery company confirmed to The Indian Express. Zomato said that active members will not be able to extend or renew their memberships once their membership tenure expires. Zomato offered discounts to 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' members while ordering food online or dining out.

169.title: I'll try to do best I can as mother, acting will take backseat: Sonam
169.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child with her husband Anand Ahuja, said, "I'll try to do the best I can as a mother, which means...acting will definitely take a backseat." However, she added she will not stop working completely. Sonam, who had last featured in the 2020 film 'AK vs AK', will next be seen in 'Blind'.

170.title: Hero Vired offers Full Stack Development program with assured placement
170.article_body: Hero Vired, in partnership with Codecademy, offers a Certificate Program in Full Stack Development with Cloud for Web & Mobile. The immersive web development program explores concepts of building applications and is designed for professionals & freshers interested in pursuing a career in app development, it shared. It includes placement assurance and 70+ live sessions with global & Indian faculty.

171.title: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeats world number one Carlsen again
171.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in his last match at FTX Crypto Cup in Miami. This year, Praggnanandhaa had also defeated Carlsen at the Airthings Masters in February and at Chessable Masters in May. Praggnanandhaa finished FTX Crypto Cup as the runner-up with 15 points, while Carlsen won the tournament with 16 points.

172.title: Filmfare withdraws Kangana's nomination, calls her accusations false; actress responds
172.article_body: Filmfare has withdrawn Kangana Ranaut's award nomination after she said she'd sue the magazine for nominating and inviting her. Calling her accusations against the award show false, Filmfare said, "We reserve all rights to pursue any legal action against her...defamatory statements." Responding to Filmfare, Kangana said, "My endeavour is to...stop such malicious award shows...see you in court."

173.title: Video of murder accused cutting birthday cake inside police van in Maharashtra goes viral
173.article_body: A video of a 28-year-old murder accused, Roshan Jha, celebrating his birthday in a police van in Kalyan, has went viral on social media. His followers handed over a cake to him from the window of the van and he cut it. "The team who was given the responsibility to produce Jha in court is facing an inquiry," officials said.

174.title: Pankaj taught me to sit, do dead eyes, open mouth expression: Alia on 'Udta...'
174.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said actor Pankaj Tripathi helped her prepare for the movie 'Udta Punjab'. "He taught me to sit and speak the way the natives do. Then he made me do lot of acting workshops, how to loosen the body, a certain expression which is dead eyes, open mouth," she said, adding she attended different workshops on body language.
