350.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi shared a video on Twitter in which an elderly woman can be seen climbing up the human pyramid for Dahi Handi celebration. Sharing the video, Chaturvedi wrote, "Age is only a number we count until we're old enough to know it doesn't count ~ Katrina Mayer. This video proves that! #DahiHandifestival is truly all encompassing."

351.title: Mehbooba Mufti claims she’s been put under house arrest, shares pics of locked gates
351.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday claimed she has been placed under house arrest again to stop her from visiting the family of Kashmiri Pandit Sunil Kumar Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists in Shopian. She shared pictures of the locked gates of her residence. Mufti said the Centre's "callous policies" have led to target killings of Kashmiri Pandits.

352.title: Congress to meet in Delhi on August 23 for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
352.article_body: Congress will hold a meeting of senior leaders on August 23 in Delhi to discuss about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. The party will start the 'Yatra' from Kanniyakumari on September 7 and culminate in Kashmir after 148 days. The Yatra will include padyatras, rallies and public meetings and is scheduled to cover a distance of 3,500 kilometre across over 12 states.

353.title: If films worked due to PM Modi's endorsement, Modi biopic would've been biggest hit: Kher
353.article_body: Talking about criticism that his film 'The Kashmir Files' worked because it was endorsed by PM Narendra Modi, actor Anupam Kher said, "If films worked due to PM Modi's endorsement, Narendra Modi biopic would have been the biggest blockbuster." "Not many people tweeted about 'The Kashmir Files', but a lot of people tweeted about the recently released films," he added.

354.title: Govt issues high severity warning for Google Chrome, asks users to update it
354.article_body: The government's CERT-In recently issued a 'high' severity rated warning for Google Chrome for Desktop, warning users about multiple vulnerabilities. The CERT-In said that the vulnerabilities exist in Chrome versions prior to 104.0.5112.101 and urged users to update their browser. Google has also confirmed existence of the security flaws and said they have been fixed in the latest Chrome update.

355.title: Security personnel being killed due to Tripura govt’s negligence: Manik Sarkar
355.article_body: After a BSF head constable was killed in Tripura, ex-CM and Opposition leader Manik Sarkar said the security personnel are being killed in state due to "negligent attitude" of the state government in combating insurgency. "The state government cannot ignore...responsibility of this loss of life," Sarkar added. "The state government should stand with...martyred BSF jawan in all ways," he stated.

356.title: Gujarat CM reshuffles Cabinet, takes charge of Revenue Ministry
356.article_body: Ahead of Assembly elections, the Gujarat government has reshuffled the Cabinet. The Revenue Ministry has been taken away from Rajendra Trivedi while the Road and Building Ministry has been taken away from Purnesh Modi. CM Bhupendra Patel will be holding both Ministries. Harsh Sanghavi, meantime, has been appointed Minister of State (MoS) with responsibility for the Revenue Ministry.

357.title: UP BJP leader beaten up by wife after getting caught with a woman; video surfaces
357.article_body: A BJP leader, identified as Mohit Sonkar, was beaten up by his wife and in-laws after they allegedly saw him in his car with another woman in Uttar Pradesh. In a video of the incident, his wife and mother-in-law could be seen beating him with slippers. ACP Babupurva, Alok Singh, said that an FIR will be registered after proper investigation.

358.title: Ishan needs to know how to make the best use of his chances: RP Singh
358.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said India batter Ishan Kishan needs to make the best use of the chances he's getting at the international level. "It's not that Ishan will not get more chances...but if your performances are not good, you'll slowly-slowly start going out," added Singh. Ishan scored six runs off 13 deliveries in the second ODI against Zimbabwe.

359.title: Amit Shah to address rally in Telangana ahead of Munugode by-polls
359.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah will be addressing a public rally in the Munugode Assembly constituency of Telangana at around 5 pm today. The by-poll is being held after Congress MLA Komatireddy Raj Gopal resigned from his post and joined BJP. Shah is further scheduled to attend another meet at Ramoji Film City after which he will fly back to Delhi.

360.title: People will give Look Out Circular to BJP after 2024 polls: Sisodia
360.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia criticised PM Narendra Modi over the alleged CBI Look Out Circular issued against him and claimed that after the 2024 Lok Sabha polls people will give a Look Out Circular to the BJP. "It’s unfortunate that the PM keeps thinking against whom should a CBI Look Out Circular be issued today," said Sisodia.

361.title: 3 journalists booked in MP over story on elderly man taken to hospital on cart
361.article_body: Three journalists in Madhya Pradesh have been booked over a story on a family taking an elderly man to a hospital on a pushcart due to unavailability of ambulance after a probe found their claim to be false, police said. The journalists identified as Kunjbihari Kaurav, NK Bhatele and Anil Sharma, work as contributors for national and regional news channels.

362.title: Anand Sharma resigns from top Himachal Pradesh Congress post
362.article_body: Congress leader and former Union minister Anand Sharma on Sunday resigned as the Chairman of the party's Steering Committee for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls. In a letter to the party chief Sonia Gandhi, Sharma reportedly said that his self-respect is non-negotiable. However, he has assured that he will participate in campaigns for the Congress candidates.

363.title: 1,000 Congress workers to touch feet of 1 lakh people in Telangana
363.article_body: Ahead of the Munugode bypolls, Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee President Revanth Reddy said that 1,000 party workers will touch feet of 1 lakh people. "Telangana gained independence on September 17. We have scheduled a programme from this very auspicious day to inform the public about the Congress party. The programme is called 'Prajaswamyam ki Padabi Vandanam',” said Reddy.

364.title: Vaishno Devi Yatra resumes after being suspended over bad weather
364.article_body: The pilgrimage to Vaishno Devi Shrine in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra resumed on Sunday morning after being temporarily suspended twice in the previous 24 hours owing to bad weather. "Police and Central Reserve Police Force have already been deployed. The situation is being monitored. No untoward incident has been reported so far," the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said.

365.title: Woman abuses, hits security guard at Noida society; video goes viral
365.article_body: A video has been widely circulated on social media that showed a woman abusing and assaulting a security guard at a society in Noida. The woman allegedly got into an argument with the guards over a delay in opening the gates. She was also heard telling the guards to "respect women". Meanwhile, the police have registered an FIR against her.

366.title: Italian artist who duct-taped banana to wall & sold it as artwork for $120,000 sued
366.article_body: Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan, who had duct-taped a banana to a wall and sold it as artwork for $120,000 at Art Basel Miami, has been accused by California-based artist Joe Morford of copying his 2000 artwork title 'Banana & Orange'. Cattelan named his artwork 'Comedian'. A Florida court has ruled that Morford can move forward with a case against Cattelan.

367.title: How does 'tomato flu' spread as number of cases in India cross 80?
367.article_body: According to Lancet, children are at an increased risk of exposure to 'tomato flu' which can spread through close contact. Children are also prone to this infection through the use of nappies, touching unclean surfaces and putting things directly into the mouth. Symptoms observed in children with 'tomato flu' include high fever, rashes, body aches and nausea, among others.

368.title: Uni suspends card services after RBI revises digital lending rules
368.article_body: Bengaluru-based credit and payments fintech firm Uni Cards has temporarily suspended active cards after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) strengthened scrutiny over digital lending. The startup is suspending Uni Pay 1/3rd Card and Uni Pay 1/2 Card in a phased process. Uni Card, used for urgent payments, will continue to give customers access to credit line through Uni Cash.

369.title: Make better films, stop being arrogant: Rahul Dholakia on B'wood
369.article_body: Filmmaker Rahul Dholakia took to Twitter and listed five things that need to be done by the film fraternity. He tweeted, "1. Make better films. 2. Reduce [cost of production] 3. Reduce ticket prices drastically 4. Not release films on OTT for three months 5. Stop being Arrogant. Be inclusive. Maybe this will help?" Dholakia directed the 2017 film 'Raees'.

370.title: ₹27 cr looted in name of beautification: Akhilesh after 2 died at Mathura temple
370.article_body: After at least two persons died during Janmashtami celebrations at Bankey Bihari temple in Mathura, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said the incident occurred due to "administrative failure". "The truth is...in the name of beautification…around Shri Bankey Bihari temple of Vrindavan, officials sitting in the Braj Teerth Vikas Parishad...looted ₹27 crore...and devotees didn't get any facilities," he added.

371.title: US-based firm Wayfair's CEO lays off 5% of its global workforce
371.article_body: US-based e-commerce company Wayfair's CEO Niraj Shah has laid off 870 employees after the company's anticipated growth did not materialise. After slashing 5% of its global workforce, the company is looking to make reductions in third party labour costs. The company is expecting layoff costs to range between $30-$40 million, which mainly consists of employee severance.

372.title: Car skids, falls off cliff 500 feet down near Pune; 3 killed, 3 injured
372.article_body: Three people were killed and three others seriously injured after a car they were travelling in  veered off a slippery road and fell off a cliff 500 feet on Pune-Mangaon road on Saturday afternoon. "Primary probe suggests that near Kondethar Sanaswadi village, the driver of the car applied brakes on a slippery patch and could not control it," police said.

373.title: Man sentenced to life plus 375 yrs for killing police officer in US
373.article_body: A man was sentenced to life in prison plus 375 years after he shot and killed a 22-year-old police officer in US' Georgia. The incident occurred when the accused fired an AK-47 at the deceased and other officers who were responding to shots fired in a house and domestic disturbance in 2015. The accused pleaded guilty to the charges.

374.title: Germany's Scholz calls Putin's critic Navalny a 'courageous man'
374.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz praised Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny who was poisoned with Soviet-era nerve agent two years ago. "I...got to know a courageous man who returned to Russia...to fight for democracy," Scholz said. Navalny, an outspoken critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin, is serving a prison sentence over charges of fraud and contempt of court.

375.title: Xi urged US to prevent Pelosi's Taiwan trip, Biden declined: Report
375.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping held a phone conversation with US President Joe Biden last month, asking him to prevent House Speaker Nancy Pelosi from visiting Taiwan, Washington Post reported. The report added that Biden told Xi he "could not oblige" as US Congress is an independent body of the government. Biden reportedly warned Xi against provocative actions during Pelosi's visit.

376.title: Working with US, EU to get Russian food to world markets: UN
376.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said that the UN is working with the US and EU to overcome obstacles to let Russian food and fertilisers reach world markets. He said nations that sanctioned Russia for invading Ukraine made clear that measures did not apply to food and fertilisers. "Getting...food...out of Ukraine and Russia is crucial to calm commodity markets," Guterres added.

377.title: Miss Universe to allow married women, mothers to compete for 1st time in 2023
377.article_body: In a first, the Miss Universe pageant will now allow married women and mothers to participate in the beauty contest in 2023. Until now, it permitted only single women to participate. According to an internal memo, the pageant said, "We...believe that women should have agency over their lives and that...personal decisions should not be a barrier to their success."

378.title: Apple extends repair program for iPhone 12 models with sound issue
378.article_body: Apple has extended its repair program for iPhone 12 models experiencing an earpiece sound issue, now covering them for three years after the first retail sale of the unit. The devices manufactured between October 2020 and April 2021 are eligible for the program. However, iPhone 12 mini and iPhone 12 Pro Max are not covered under it.

379.title: Nearly half of Tigray's population is in severe need of food aid: WFP
379.article_body: Ethiopia's nearly two-year conflict left half of Tigray's population in 'severe' need of food as aid groups struggle to reach due to insufficient fuel supplies, according to the World Food Programme. The report said that half of the pregnant or lactating women are facing malnutrition. The UN agency said even though aid delivery resumed after unilateral ceasefire, malnutrition rate 'skyrocketed'.

380.title: Such things happen, he's coming back after a long time: Kaif on Rahul's 1(5)
380.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said he is not concerned about KL Rahul's form after the 30-year-old got out after scoring one run off five balls in the second ODI against Zimbabwe. "Such things happen, he's coming back after a long time...It was a pitched-up delivery that came in," stated Kaif. Rahul was playing his first international innings since February.

381.title: At the moment, Axar Patel & Jadeja are on par with each other: Ajay Jadeja
381.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said Axar Patel is at par with Ravindra Jadeja and the only thing that differentiates them is the fielding. "Axar has added to the batting so much more in the last few years," he added. Ajay further said, "Axar is on his (Jadeja's) back, and it's great for Indian cricket."

382.title: After Wipro, TCS delays variable pay for some employees: Report
382.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reportedly delayed the variable pay for senior employees for the June quarter, days after its rival company Wipro paused variable payouts to mid and senior-level employees. TCS will pay the variable compensation to its employees by August-end now, as per reports. In a statement, TCS said its compensation and bonus cycles are as per plan.

383.title: Ex-BJP Rajasthan MLA who admitted 5 lynchings on camera booked
383.article_body: The Rajasthan Police booked former BJP MLA Gyan Dev Ahuja who was recorded saying that his supporters had "lynched five individuals" for cow smuggling. The case was opened after a video went viral in which Ahuja was asking a group of people to start an agitation against lynching of Chiranjilal Saini, who was allegedly lynched by Mev Muslim community members.

384.title: Pixel owners unable to wirelessly charge after Android 13 update
384.article_body: Some Pixel owners have reported being unable to wirelessly charge after the Android 13 update. Several Reddit posts about the issue were from people using the Pixel 4, 4 XL, 6, and 6 Pro using a variety of wireless chargers. In some cases, the phones do seem to recognise that they are on a wireless charger.

385.title: Indian women still use sieve on Karwa Chauth, unfortunate: Raj minister
385.article_body: Rajasthan minister Govind Ram Meghwal on Saturday said it's unfortunate that even today, women in India see the moon through a sieve on Karwa Chauth and talk about their husband’s long life, while those in China and US are living in the world of science. "A husband never sees a sieve for the long life of his wife," Meghwal added.

386.title: Apple CFO Luca Maestri sells shares worth $16.9 million
386.article_body: Apple CFO Luca Maestri has sold 96,735 shares in the firm for $16.9 million, an SEC filing showed. Maestri carried out two sales of shares on August 17 where one transaction was for 66,390 shares, while the other saw the sale of 30,345 shares. Maestri sold the shares as part of an arranged trading plan adopted by him in 2020.

387.title: Can consider inquiry against ex-PM's portfolios controversy: Aus PM
387.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said his government could consider launching an inquiry into former PM Scott Morrison for secretly taking charge of key ministerial roles during the pandemic. Albanese would seek Solicitor General's advice over the legality of Morrison's actions. Morrison defended himself by saying he felt the nation's responsibility during the pandemic was his alone.

388.title: Jennifer Lopez, Ben Affleck get married for 2nd time; pics go viral
388.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck on Saturday got married for the second time at Affleck's Georgia home, days after the couple got married in Las Vegas. Actors Matt Damon and Jason Mewes were reportedly among the guests. This comes amid reports that Affleck's mother was hospitalised after she fell off a dock at the venue a day before the wedding.

389.title: Zelenskyy warns of 'vicious' Russian attack ahead of Independence Day
389.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned that Russia might do something "ugly" and "vicious" ahead of celebrations to mark 31 years of independence from Soviet rule. Curfew in Ukraine's second largest city Kharkiv will remain in place for the entire day on Wednesday. Zelenskyy said Ukrainians must not allow Moscow to spread despondency and fear ahead of August 24 events.

390.title: Agencies are being weaponised, Oppn should’ve rallied together: Mufti
390.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised Congress for agitating against another Opposition party. "Sad that Congress is unable to rise above party interests because AAP is a formidable opponent...At a time when agencies are being weaponised, Opposition should’ve rallied together," Mufti tweeted. Her remark came as the Delhi wing of the Congress called for Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's resignation.

391.title: List of 100 loan apps used to extort ₹500 crore released as Delhi Police bust racket
391.article_body: Delhi Police's special unit released a list of over 100 loan apps after busting a ₹500 crore extortion racket and arresting 22 people in connection with the case. It was found that the loan apps uploaded user data to China and Hong Kong-based servers. The listed apps include Loan Cube, Wow Rupee, Smart Wallet, Giant Wallet, Hi Rupee, Swift Rupee.

392.title: Did costume rehearsals, look tests: Alia on Bhansali's 'Balika Vadhu'
392.article_body: Alia Bhatt revealed that she had done costume rehearsals, look tests and even danced on 'Dola Re Dola' for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Balika Vadhu'. "When he decided to make ['Balika Vadhu']...I was about nine...he said...'I'll wait a couple of years...make it when you are like a little older', but then I think he dropped the idea altogether," she added.

393.title: Russia's Gazprom to shut natural gas pipeline to Europe for 3 days
393.article_body: Russia will halt natural gas supplies to Europe for three days as Nord Stream pipeline will be shut due to maintenance work at a key compressor station, according to state-owned energy company Gazprom. The shutdown will be between August 31 and September 2, it added. In July, Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline was closed for 10 days for maintenance work.

394.title: Shouldn't we release our movies?: Vijay Deverakonda on boycott B'wood trend
394.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda talked about the boycott Bollywood trends on social media. "I don't know exactly what is their (online trolls) issue and what they want," he stated. Vijay revealed they began working on 'Liger' in 2019. He added, "We've worked hard for three years to make this [film]. Shouldn't we release our movies? Should we sit in homes?"

395.title: Karnataka proposes policy to penalise unnecessary use of water
395.article_body: Karnataka, one of the most water-stressed states in India with reportedly about 61% of it in a drought-prone region, has proposed a new water policy to tackle the challenges. The new policy includes measures like penalties for unwise use of water, restricting groundwater extraction and optimising the use of the state's limited water resources, Water Resources Department officials said.

396.title: 3.5 tons of cocaine found in banana shipments in Ecuador, seized
396.article_body: Authorities have seized around 3.5 tons of cocaine which was found in two banana shipments at separate locations in Ecuador, police said on Saturday. One of the shipments, which contained 2,300 cocaine packets, was intercepted by police as it approached the port city of Guayaquil. The other shipment had 1,218 cocaine packets. The containers were bound for UK and Netherlands.

397.title: Mahakal priests urge Zomato to withdraw 'offensive' Hrithik ad, company apologises
397.article_body: Priests from Ujjain's Mahakal temple urged Zomato to withdraw its recent advertisement featuring actor Hrithik Roshan as it offended Hindu sentiments. In the ad, Roshan was seen ordering a 'thali' from 'Mahakal'. Apologising for it, Zomato said that while the ad referred to a thali from Ujjain’s Mahakal Restaurant and doesn't involve Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple, it's now no longer running.

398.title: Mumbai pharmacy worker assaulted over power disruption during Dahi Handi
398.article_body: A 25-year-old pharmacy worker was allegedly dragged out and assaulted by some people over disruption of electricity during a 'Dahi Handi' event in Maharashtra's Nallasopara. One of the accused, Raju Shelar, told the victim that the pharmacy had allowed organisers to take power supply from the shop but it was disrupted. The victim said Shelar pelted a stone at him.

399.title: Gaikwad, Tripathi are waiting, it'd be unfair if they don't get a game: Uthappa
399.article_body: Veteran Indian batter Robin Uthappa has said it would be unfair if Ruturaj Gaikwad and Rahul Tripathi, who are part of the squad for the Zimbabwe series, don't get to play in the third and final ODI. Uthappa further said Deepak Chahar might return for the final ODI. Deepak had registered figures of 3/27 in the first game.

400.title: Over ₹1 cr to be spent on Hyderabad's Khairatabad Ganesh idol
400.article_body: More than ₹1 crore will be spent on preparation of Hyderabad's Khairatabad Ganesh idol, which will reportedly be tallest Ganesh idol in India this year. The committee has decided to install eco-friendly idol made of clay instead of POP. "Artists have come from Chennai to do clay work. 50-100 people are working here on this idol," a devotee said.
